member.name: T:MSharp.Framework.ClonedDocument

member.name: T:MSharp.Framework.Services.TemporaryFilePath
member.summary:
This class provides a unique file path in a temporary folder (i.e. in the application temp folder in the system by default and can be provided in Config of the application through a setting with key "Application.TemporaryFilesPath") After this instance is disposed any possibly created file in the path will be deleted physically.
If this class fails to dispose an application event will be added to the projects database.

member.summary: Sends the specified SMS item. It will try several times to deliver the message. The number of retries can be specified in AppConfig of "SMS.Maximum.Retries". If it is not declared in web.config, then 3 retires will be used. Note: The actual SMS Sender component must be implemented as a public type that implements ISMSSender interface. The assembly qualified name of that component, must be specified in AppConfig of "SMS.Sender.Type".

member.summary: Occurs when an exception happens when sending an sms. Sender parameter will be the ISmsQueueItem instance that couldn't be sent.

member.summary: Sends the specified SMS item. It will try several times to deliver the message. The number of retries can be specified in AppConfig of "SMS.Maximum.Retries". If it is not declared in web.config, then 3 retires will be used. Note: The actual SMS Sender component must be implemented as a public type that implements ISMSSender interface. The assembly qualified name of that component, must be specified in AppConfig of "SMS.Sender.Type".

member.name: F:System.LocalTime.CurrentTimeZone
member.summary: By default provides the current server's timezone. You can override this to provide user-specific time-zones or based on any other system setting.

member.name: F:System.LocalTime.GlobalNowGetter
member.summary: If set, it will provide the "Now" value. Note: This has lower priority than thread-level overrides.

summary.para: Gets the local current date/time of the application.
By default it equals to System.DateTime.Now.
To override its value, you should wrap the calling code inside "using (LocalTime.SetNow(some date)) { ... }"
Examples:
var now = LocalTime.Now // which is identical to DateTime.Now
using (LocalTime.Set(DateTime.Parse("15/01/2000 06:13")))
var date = LocalTime.Now; // that sets date to 15th Jan 200 at 6:13.

member.name: P:System.LocalTime.UtcNow
member.summary: Gets the current Universal Time.

summary.para: Gets the local current date of the application (no time).
By default it equals to System.DateTime.Today.
To override its value, you should wrap the calling code inside "using (LocalTime.SetNow(some date)) { ... }"
Examples:
var now = LocalTime.Today // which is identical to DateTime.Today
using (LocalTime.Set(DateTime.Parse("15/01/2000 06:13")))
var date = LocalTime.Today; // that sets date to 15th Jan 200.

member.name: P:System.LocalTime.UtcToday
member.summary: Gets the current Universal Time's date part (without time).

summary.para: Sets the current time of the application.
Examples:
using (LocalTime.Set(DateTime.Parse("15/01/2000 06:13")))
//Here any call for LocalTime.Now/Today will return 15th of Jan 2000 (at 6:30).
Sets the current time function of the application.

member.name: M:System.LocalTime.RedefineNow(System.Func{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Sets the current time function of the application. Note: This has lower priority than thread-level time setting.

summary.para: Freezes the time to the current system time.
Examples:
using (LocalTime.Stop())
// Freezes the time to Datetime.Now.
